course.subject: ELEC
course.name: Advanced Analog IC Analysis and Design
course.description: Noise analysis; Advanced op-amp design techniques; Analog VLSI building blocks: multipliers, oscillators, mixers, phase-locked loops, A/D and D/A converters; Passive filter design; Frequency scaling; Active filter design.

reviews.author: Mikoto
reviews.title: Challenging Analog Course
reviews.comment_content:
Including amplifier design, noise analysis, and active filter design.
All contents are challenging and need an excellent analog design background.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Luong describes everything very clearly but amazingly fast. If you aren't familiar with it, you may be unable to catch up. Fortunately, we have a ZOOM recording.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is relatively high. There are no exams, and two projects in the course. The first one is a fully differential amplifier design with a changeful spec. Don't worry, you may be unable to satisfy all the specs. The final one is an active filter design, if you have a background of signal and system, it won't be a problem.
